In this paragraph, "isotonic sodium chloride" and "sodium chloride" refer to the same substance, which is a solution of sodium ions (Na+) and chloride ions (Cl-), and the term "isotonic" indicates that the solution has the same osmotic pressure as body fluids. "Sodium bicarbonate" is a compound consisting of sodium ions (Na+) and bicarbonate ions (HCO3-). "Diltiazem" is a specific calcium channel blocker drug. "Calcium channel blocker" is a class of drugs that inhibit the movement of calcium ions (Ca2+) through calcium channels in the cell membrane.
